result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. 

Defendant shall contact the Washington County Jail within 3 days for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant is serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando Hernandez

records.addlTxt: Defendant Orlando Hernandez in court, in custody. Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Orlando Hernandez. Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea form on file; agreement reached for plea to count #1 with counsel free to argue sentence. Def pleads guilty to count #1; def is convicted. Argument by counsel on sentence. Count #2 is dismissed and read in. Defendant sentenced.
Plea hearing on October 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on Oct 24, 2022 at 9:45 am reset to Oct 12, 2022 at 8:15 am per request of Atty Beltran. DA advised they were unable to reach victim for position. Notice sent.

Defendant Orlando Hernandez appeared by video, in custody. Defendant Orlando Hernandez in court. Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Orlando Hernandez. Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Offer received; will meet with def. Plea hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Plea hearing on October 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Orlando Hernandez appeared by video from Washington Co Jail, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Orlando Hernandez. Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Offer received. Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea hearing on September 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Orlando Hernandez appeared by video from Wash Co Jail, in custody. Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Orlando Hernandez. Counsel's first appearance. Offer received. Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Absolute sobriety; No violent contact with FH; No contact with FH's residence; Defendant allowed one 20 min visit to the residence while law enforcement is present to obtain personal belongings

Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Orlando Hernandez appeared by video from Washington County Jail.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Orlando Hernandez. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Argument on bond. Court sets $600 sig bond.
Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
